note.p: Birth: Frankfurt am Main, Germany (12 September 1851)
Death: Yeldall, near Twyford, Berkshire (14 October 1934)
Education: Geneva; Owen's College, Manchester; Heidelberg. PhD (Heidelberg)
Career: Professor of Physics, University of Manchester (1888-1907); President, British Association (1915)
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1893; Rumford Medal 1926; Copley Medal 1931
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1932-1935 vol l pp 409-423, plate, by G C Simpson
References: A G Cock, 'Chauvinism and Internationalism in Science: The International Research Council, 1919-1926' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 249-288
Lawrence Badash, 'British and American Views of the German Menace in World War I' in NR 1979-80 vol 34 pp 91-121
Peter Alter, 'The Royal Society and the International Association of Academies 1897-1919' in NR 1979-80 vol 34 pp 241-264
